<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	59
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	DIRECTORS&#146; RESPONSIBILITIES FOR THE ACCOUNTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The directors are responsible for the preparation of the Annual Report, including the remuneration report in accordance with relevant UK legislation
	and other UK requirements. The directors are required by UK company law to prepare accounts for each financial year that give a true and fair view of the state of affairs of the Company and of the Group as at the end of the financial year and of the
	results of the Group for the year. In preparing the accounts, appropriate UK accounting policies have been used and applied consistently, and reasonable and prudent judgements and estimates have been made. Applicable UK accounting standards have
	been followed. The directors have satisfied themselves from internal forecasts and available bank facilities that the Group continues as a going concern.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The directors are also responsible for the maintenance of the Group&#146;s system of internal financial controls. These are designed to give reasonable assurance that proper
	procedures exist for the maintenance of adequate accounting records, safeguarding the assets of the Group and for preventing and detecting fraud and other irregularities. To this end the Company has identified and documented minimum internal
	financial control standards. Annual budgets are prepared and approved by the directors, and the directors have reserved capital expenditure and treasury authority levels to the Board and its delegated committees. The Group operates a system of
	regular monthly reporting including revised profit and cash forecasts. Business risks are identified and monitored on a regular basis. The Group operates an internal audit function which monitors the adequacy of internal financial controls and
	systems and compliance with Group standards. The internal auditor gives a report to the Audit Committee and the Audit Committee reviews the operation and effectiveness of internal financial controls and reporting of the Group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A copy of the Annual Report is placed on the website of Smith &amp; Nephew plc. Information published
	on the internet is accessible in many countries with different legal requirements. Legislation in the UK governing the preparation and dissemination of accounts may differ from legislation in other jurisdictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	INDEPENDENT AUDITORS&#146; REPORTS TO THE MEMBERS OF SMITH &amp; NEPHEW PLC
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	United Kingdom Report
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have audited the Group&#146;s accounts for the year ended 31 December 2003 which comprise the Group profit and loss account, Group balance sheet, parent company balance sheet, Group cash flow statement, Group statement of total
	recognised gains and losses, Group reconciliation of movements in shareholders&#146; funds and the related Notes 1 to 40. These accounts have been prepared on the basis of the accounting policies set out therein. We have also audited the information
	in the remuneration report that is described as having been audited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Respective Responsibilities of Directors and Auditors
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The directors&#146; responsibilities for preparing the annual report,
	remuneration report and the accounts in accordance with applicable United Kingdom law and accounting standards are set out in the Statement of Directors&#146; Responsibilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our responsibility is to audit the accounts and the part of the remuneration report to be audited in accordance with relevant legal and regulatory
	requirements, United Kingdom Auditing Standards and the Listing Rules of the Financial Services Authority.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We report to you our opinion as to whether the accounts give a true and fair view and whether the accounts and the part of the remuneration report to be audited have been properly prepared in accordance with the Companies Act
	1985. We also report to you if, in our opinion, the directors&#146; report is not consistent with the accounts, if the company has not kept proper accounting records, if we have not received all the information and explanations we require for our
	audit, or if the information specified by law or the Listing Rules regarding directors&#146; remuneration and transactions with the Group is not disclosed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We review whether the corporate governance statement reflects the company&#146;s compliance with the seven provisions of the Combined Code specified for our review by the Listing
	Rules, and we report if it does not. We are not required to consider whether the Board&#146;s statements on internal control cover all risks and controls, or form an opinion on the effectiveness of the Group&#146;s corporate governance procedures or
	its risk and control procedures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We read other information contained in the annual
	report and consider whether it is consistent with the audited accounts. This other information comprises the directors&#146; responsibilities for the accounts, unaudited part of the remuneration report, corporate and social responsibility and
	corporate governance statement. We consider the implications for our report if we become aware of any apparent misstatements or material inconsistencies with the accounts. Our responsibilities do not extend to any other information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Basis of Audit Opinion
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with United Kingdom Auditing Standards issued by the Auditing Practices Board. An audit includes examination, on a test basis, of evidence
	relevant to the amounts and disclosures in the accounts and the part of the remuneration report to be audited. It also includes an assessment of the significant estimates and judgements made by the directors in the preparation of the accounts, and
	of whether the accounting policies are appropriate to the Group&#146;s circumstances, consistently applied and adequately disclosed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We planned and performed our audit so as to obtain all the information and explanations which we considered necessary in order to provide us with sufficient evidence to give
	reasonable assurance that the financial statements and the part of the remuneration report to be audited are free from material misstatement, whether caused by fraud or other irregularity or error. In forming our opinion we also evaluated the
	overall adequacy of the presentation of information in the accounts and the part of the remuneration report to be audited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Opinion
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In our opinion the accounts give a true and fair view of the state
	of affairs of the company and of the Group as at 31 December 2003 and of the profit of the Group for the year then ended; and the financial statements and the part of the remuneration report to be audited have been properly prepared in accordance
	with the Companies Act 1985.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Ernst &amp; Young LLP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Registered Auditor
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	London, England
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	16 March 2004
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	61
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	United States Report
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have audited the
	accompanying Group balance sheets of Smith &amp; Nephew plc as of 31 December 2003 and 2002, and the related Group profit and loss accounts and Group statements of total recognised gains and losses, movements in shareholders&#146; funds and cash
	flows for each of the three years in the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2003. These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our
	audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with United Kingdom auditing standards and
	United States generally accepted auditing standards. Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on
	a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial
	statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of the Smith &amp; Nephew Group as at 31 December 2003 and 2002, and the consolidated results of its
	operations and its consolidated cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended 31 December 2003, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United Kingdom which differ in certain respects from those generally
	accepted in the United States (see Note 40 of Notes to the Financial Statements).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Ernst &amp; Young LLP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	London, England
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	16 March 2004
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	62
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Ongoing operations
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

</TD>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	A summary of the adjustments to attributable profit for the financial year that would be required had accounting principles generally accepted in the US been applied rather than those
	generally accepted in the UK is set out in Note 40 of the Notes to the Accounts.
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	63

<HR WIDTH="0" SIZE="3" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<HR SIZE="3" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<HR WIDTH="0" SIZE="3" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Approved by the Board on 16 March 2004.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dudley Eustace
</B>
	Chairman
<B>
	Christopher O&#146;Donnell
</B>
	Chief Executive
<B>
	Peter Hooley
</B>
	Finance Director
</FONT>
</P>
<HR WIDTH="10%" SIZE="1" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	2002 figures have been restated for the adoption of UITF 38 (see Note 27 of the Notes to the Accounts).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	NOTES TO THE ACCOUNTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The accounts have been prepared under the
	historical cost convention and in accordance with applicable UK accounting standards, include the disclosures required by Financial Reporting Standard 17 (&#147;FRS 17&#148;) and comply with Urgent Issues Task Force Abstract 38 (&#147;UITF
	38&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Consolidation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group accounts include the accounts of Smith &amp; Nephew plc (the &#147;Company&#148;) and all the subsidiaries and associated undertakings during the year
	ended 31 December 2003 for the periods during which they were members of the Group. In these financial statements, &#147;Group&#148; means the Company and all its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Entities in which the Group holds an interest on a long-term basis and which are controlled by the Group and one other under a
	contractual agreement are joint ventures. Joint ventures are included in the consolidated accounts under the gross equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Entities in which the Group has a beneficial interest of 50% or less in the equity capital and where the Group exercises significant influence over commercial and
	financial policy decisions are associated undertakings. Associates are included in the consolidated accounts under the equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Turnover
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Turnover comprises sales of
	products and services to third parties at amounts invoiced net of trade discounts and rebates, excluding turnover taxes. Turnover from the sale of products and services is recognised upon transfer to the customer of the significant risks and rewards
	of ownership. This is generally when goods are dispatched to, or services performed for, customers except that sales of stock located at customer premises and available for customers&#146; immediate use are recognised on notification that the
	product has been implanted or used. Appropriate provisions for returns, trade discounts and other allowances are deducted from turnover. Other turnover is recorded as earned or as services are performed.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Foreign Currencies
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Balance sheet items of overseas companies and foreign currency borrowings are translated into sterling at the year-end rates of exchange. Profit and loss items and
	the cash flows of overseas subsidiary undertakings and associated undertakings are translated at the average rates for the year.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Forward currency contracts in respect of contracted and anticipated amounts payable on purchase transactions are accounted for as hedges with the hedge transaction
	recorded at the rate implicit in the contract. Changes in the fair value of these forward contracts are recognised in the profit and loss account on the ultimate sale of the item purchased.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following are recorded as movements in reserves: exchange differences on the
	translation at closing rates of exchange of overseas opening net assets, including acquisition goodwill; the difference on translation of foreign currency borrowings or swaps that are used to finance or hedge Group equity investments; and the
	differences arising between the translation of profits at average and closing exchange rates. All other exchange differences are dealt with in arriving at profit before taxation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Intangible Fixed Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Prior to 1 January 1998, goodwill representing the excess of purchase consideration over fair value of net assets acquired was set-off against reserves in the year of acquisition. Goodwill acquired since 31 December 1997 and
	other acquired intangibles are capitalised and amortised on a straight line basis over their estimated useful economic lives, between 3 and 20 years, except for goodwill arising on the formation of the BSN Medical joint venture and acquisition of
	the Group&#146;s share of the AbilityOne associated undertaking, which is not amortised but is subject to an annual impairment review. This treatment, which is a departure from the requirement of the Companies Act 1985 of Great Britain (the
	&#147;Companies Act&#148;) to amortise goodwill, is adopted in order to show a true and fair view (See Note 16 and Note 17). Where applicable, goodwill previously set-off against reserves is deducted in the calculation of gains on disposal.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Accounting Policies &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The carrying value of goodwill and acquired intangibles is reviewed for impairment at the end of the first full financial year following acquisition and in other
	periods if significant events or changes in circumstances indicate the carrying value may be impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Purchased patents, know-how, trademarks, licences and distribution rights are capitalised and amortised over their estimated useful lives of periods between 3 and
	15 years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The carrying values of intangibles are reviewed for impairment
	when events or changes in circumstances indicate the carrying value may be impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Research and Development
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Revenue expenditure on research and development is written off as
	incurred.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Tangible Fixed Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Tangible fixed assets are stated at cost less depreciation and provision for impairment where appropriate. Freehold land is not depreciated. Freehold and long
	leasehold buildings are depreciated on a straight-line basis at between 1% and 5% per annum. Short leasehold land and buildings (leases of under 50 years) are depreciated by equal annual instalments over the term of the lease. Plant and equipment is
	depreciated over lives ranging between three and 20 years by equal annual instalments to write down the assets to their estimated disposal value at the end of their working lives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Finance costs relating to the purchase of fixed assets are not capitalised.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Leasing Commitments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Assets held under finance leases are capitalised as tangible fixed assets and depreciated accordingly. The capital element of future lease payments is included in
	borrowings and interest is charged to profit before taxation on a reducing balance basis over the term of the lease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Rentals payable under operating leases are charged to the profit and loss account as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Investments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Trade investments are stated at cost less provision for any permanent diminution in value.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Stocks
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Finished goods and work-in-progress
	are valued at factory cost, including appropriate overheads, on a first-in first-out basis. Raw materials are valued at purchase price. All stocks are reduced to net realisable value where lower than cost.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Orthopaedic instruments are generally not sold but loaned to customers and distributors
	for use in orthopaedic surgery. They are recorded as stock until they are deployed at which point they are transferred to fixed assets and depreciated over their useful lives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Financial Instruments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Currency swaps to match foreign currency net assets with foreign currency liabilities are translated into Sterling at year-end exchange rates. Changes in the principal values of currency swaps are matched in reserves against changes in the
	values of the related assets. Interest rate swaps to protect interest costs and income are accounted for as hedges. Changes in the values of interest rate swaps are recognised against interest in the period relating to the hedge.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Deferred Taxation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Deferred taxation is recognised in respect of all timing differences that have originated but not reversed at the balance sheet date where transactions or events
	have occurred at that date that will result in an obligation to pay more, or a right to pay less or to receive more, tax.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	No provision is made for deferred tax that would arise on the remittance of the retained earnings of overseas subsidiaries, associates and joint ventures except to
	the extent that, at the balance sheet date, dividends have been accrued as receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Accounting Policies &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Deferred tax assets are recognised only to the extent that the directors consider that it is likely that taxable income will be available against which future
	reversals of the underlying timing differences can be made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Deferred tax
	is measured on an undiscounted basis at the tax rates that are expected to apply in the periods in which timing differences are expected to reverse. These are based on tax rates and laws substantively enacted at the balance sheet date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Post-Retirement Benefits
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group&#146;s major pension plans are of the defined benefit type. For these plans, costs are charged to operating profit so as to spread the expense of
	providing future pensions to employees over their working lives with the Group. For defined contribution plans, contributions are charged to operating profit as they become payable. Where the Group provides healthcare benefits after retirement, the
	expected cost of these is charged to operating profit over the employees&#146; working lives with the Group.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Use of Estimates
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The preparation of
	accounts requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the accounts and the reported amounts of revenues and
	expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	2(a).
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segmental Analysis &#151; Information Required Under UK GAAP
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Discontinued operations in 2002
	comprise the results of the rehabilitation business up until its disposal in March 2002. In 2001 discontinued operations comprise the results of the rehabilitation business and the results of the ear, nose and throat business until its disposal in
	June 2001.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On 1 April 2001, the Group&#146;s casting and bandaging and
	traditional woundcare businesses were contributed to a joint venture with Beiersdorf AG called BSN Medical in return for a 50% equity interest. The results of these businesses prior to contribution represent operations contributed to the joint
	venture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	70

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Items between Group operating
	profit of &pound;179.8m (2002 &#151; &pound;150.7m, 2001 &#151; &pound;154.0m) and profit on ordinary activities before taxation of &pound;230.1m (2002 &#151; &pound;177.9m, 2001 &#151; &pound;193.6m) comprise share of operating profit of the joint
	venture &pound;20.0m (2002 &#151; &pound;17.0m, 2001 &#151; &pound;7.8m), share of operating profit of the associated undertaking of &pound;4.8m (2002 &#151; &pound;4.9m, 2001 &#151; nil), net profit on disposals of &pound;31.5m (2002 &#151;
	&pound;18.0m, 2001 &#151; &pound;49.2m) and net interest payable of &pound;6.0m (2002 &#151; &pound;12.7m, 2001 &#151; &pound;17.4m) which are not allocated segmentally.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Exceptional costs within Ongoing operations are allocated as follows: Orthopaedics &pound;17.6m (2002 &#151; &pound;0.8m, 2001 &#151;
	&pound;0.6m), Endoscopy &pound;4.8m (2002 &#151; &pound;7.6m, 2001 &#151; &pound;0.3m) and Advanced wound management nil (2002 &#151; &pound;21.5m, 2000 &#151; &pound;18.4m). Amortisation of goodwill of &pound;18.5m (2002 &#151; &pound;17.5m, 2001
	&#151; &pound;10.4m) within Ongoing operations arose as follows: Orthopaedics &pound;4.1m (2002 &#151; &pound;4.7m, 2001 &#151; &pound;4.1m), Endoscopy &pound;8.5m (2002 &#151; &pound;7.1m, 2001 &#151; &pound;1.0m) and Advanced wound management
	&pound;5.9m (2002 &#151; &pound;5.7m, 2001 &#151; &pound;5.3m).
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Ongoing operations exceptional
	costs of &pound;22.4m were incurred as follows: &pound;17.6m in the United Kingdom and &pound;4.8m in the United States in 2003 (2002 &#151; &pound;29.9m: United Kingdom &pound;1.5m, Continental Europe &pound;2.4m, United States &pound;25.8m, Other
	America &pound;0.1m and Africa, Asia and Australasia &pound;0.1m, 2001 &#151; &pound;19.3m: United Kingdom &pound;11.7m, Continental Europe &pound;5.1m, United States &pound;1.5m and Africa, Asia and Australasia &pound;1.0m). Nil was charged to
	Operations contributed to the joint venture in 2003 (2002 &#151; nil, 2001 &#151; &pound;1.8m).
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Amortisation of goodwill of &pound;18.5m (2002 &#151; &pound;17.5m, 2001 &#151; &pound;10.4m) within Ongoing operations arose as follows: &pound;1.3m (2002 &#151;
	&pound;1.2m, 2001 &#151; &pound;0.9m) in the United Kingdom, &pound;2.6m (2002 &#151; &pound;2.1m, 2001 &#151; &pound;2.1m) in Continental Europe, &pound;14.1m (2002 &#151; &pound;13.7m, 2001 &#151; &pound;6.9m) in the United States and &pound;0.5m
	(2002 &#151; &pound;0.5m, 2001 &#151; &pound;0.5m) in Africa, Asia and Australasia.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">

	Operating assets for 2002 and
	2001 have been restated for the impact of UITF 38 (see Note 27).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Operating assets comprise fixed assets, stocks and debtors less creditors and provisions other than investment in the joint venture, investment in the associated undertaking, net debt, taxation and dividends.
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	72

</P>

<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	2(b).
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segmental Analysis &#151; Information Required Under US GAAP
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following business and geographic segmental information is required by SFAS 131&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Disclosures about Segments of an Enterprise and Related
	Information and has been derived from the Group&#146;s management reports.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Group management reviews and monitors business unit performance by use of key performance indicators which differ in certain respects from the way results are reported in the Group Accounts which are determined by UK and US GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Business units report sales of Ongoing Operations only and at constant
	rates of exchange throughout a particular year. The effects of currency movements are excluded by setting at the beginning of each year exchange rates which remain constant throughout the year. These are termed the Management Rates (&#147;MR&#148;)
	for the year. These are reset each year and prior year comparative data re-translated to the new rates. Additional sales brought in by acquisitions, for which there are no prior year comparatives, are excluded from the calculation of underlying
	sales growth which is management&#146;s key indicator of sales performance. In the tables below, underlying sales growth can be calculated by dividing current year turnover at MR by comparative prior year turnover at MR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Business units report operating profit of Ongoing Operations before goodwill
	amortisation and exceptional items and at constant rates of exchange during the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Management believes its internal reporting measures are the most appropriate since they focus on underlying business performance and exclude the distorting effects of exchange rate translation and non-operating items. These
	measures are used in all financial reporting, budgets, planning and incentive plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Results in the Group Accounts are reported at the average rates for each year (&#147;AR&#148;) (see Note 1 and Note 29).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group&#146;s business segments are the same as the activities analysed in Note 2(a).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Capital expenditure comprises
	additions of tangible and intangible fixed assets. In addition, in 2003, &pound;0.6m of additions to trade investments related to Orthopaedics (2002 &#151; &pound;1.3m, 2001 &#151; &pound;2.4m).
</FONT>

	&pound;22.4m were incurred as follows: cost of sales &pound;4.8m and administration &pound;17.6m.

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Exceptional Items
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2003, operating exceptional items within continuing operations of &pound;22.4m comprise &pound;17.6m of costs, net of a break fee of &pound;10.8m, written off as
	a consequence of the unsuccessful public offers to purchase Centerpulse AG and Incentive Capital AG and &pound;4.8m of acquisition integration costs. The Group&#146;s share of exceptional items of the joint venture relates to its share of
	manufacturing rationalisation costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2002, operating exceptional
	items of &pound;29.9m comprised &pound;17.5m for the write-down of the Group&#146;s trade investment in the common stock of Advanced Tissue Sciences, Inc., &pound;8.4m for the acquisition integration of ORATEC and Dermagraft and &pound;4.0m for
	further rationalisation consequent on the contribution of businesses to BSN Medical in 2001. The Group&#146;s share of exceptional items of the joint venture related to its share of manufacturing rationalisation costs.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2001, operating exceptional items within Ongoing operations of &pound;19.3m
	comprised &pound;2.9m manufacturing rationalisation, &pound;7.5m rationalisation consequent on the contribution of the businesses to BSN Medical and &pound;8.9m integration in connection with the acquisition of the Advanced Woundcare business from
	Beiersdorf AG. Operating exceptional items of &pound;1.8m within Operations contributed to the joint venture represented manufacturing rationalisation costs of operations subsequently contributed to BSN Medical. The Group&#146;s share of exceptional
	items of the joint venture related to its share of manufacturing rationalisation costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Net Profit and Loss on Disposals
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Net cash consideration of &pound;52.4m was received on the disposal of the 21.5% equity interest in AbilityOne Corporation (AbilityOne) to Patterson Dental Inc. in
	September 2003. A net profit of &pound;31.5m arose after writing off &pound;8.2m of acquisition goodwill previously set-off against reserves and &pound;1.1m of adjustments in respect of previous disposals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A net profit of &pound;17.2m arose on the disposal of the rehabilitation business in
	March 2002 for a net cash consideration of &pound;71.3m and a 21.5% equity interest in AbilityOne. The net profit consists of a gain of &pound;47.2m less &pound;30.0m of acquisition goodwill previously set-off against reserves. In addition, a net
	gain of &pound;0.8m arose on adjustments in respect of previous disposals.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The net profit on disposal in 2001 of &pound;49.2m related to the sale of the ear, nose and throat business in June 2001 for a net cash consideration of &pound;61.7m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	77
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Of the other pension costs
	&pound;16.9m (2002 &#151; &pound;11.0m, 2001 &#151; &pound;7.8m) relates to defined benefit plans and &pound;4.7m (2002 &#151; &pound;3.3m, 2001 &#151; &pound;2.6m) relates to defined contribution plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Directors&#146; Emoluments
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Aggregate emoluments of the directors, including pension entitlements of &pound;126,000 (2002 &#151; &pound;106,000, 2001 &#151; &pound;81,000), were
	&pound;2,119,000 (2002 &#151; &pound;1,823,000, 2001 &#151; &pound;1,685,000). The emoluments of the highest paid director excluding pension entitlement were &pound;1,030,000 (2002 &#151; &pound;856,000, 2001 &#151; &pound;770,000). The accrued
	pension of the highest paid director at the end of the year was &pound;195,000 (2002 &#151;&pound;153,000, 2001 &#151; &pound;119,000).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Information concerning individual directors&#146; emoluments pension entitlements, shareholdings and share options is shown in the &#147;Remuneration Report&#148;
	on pages 56 to 58.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The tax charge was reduced by
	&pound;4.3m in 2003, of which &pound;0.8m arose in the joint venture, as a consequence of the exceptional costs relating to the rationalisation and acquisition integration costs and the unsuccessful public offers to purchase Centerpulse AG and
	Incentive Capital AG and increased by &pound;16.1m as a result of the exceptional profit on disposal of the associated undertaking, leaving the tax charge on profits before exceptional items at &pound;70.2m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The tax charge was reduced by &pound;12.7m in 2002, of which &pound;0.6m arose in the
	joint venture, as a consequence of the exceptional costs of the write-off of the Advanced Tissue Sciences, Inc., investment and rationalisation and acquisition integration costs and increased by &pound;16.9m as a result of the exceptional profit on
	disposal, leaving the tax charge on profits before exceptional items at &pound;61.6m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The tax charge was reduced by &pound;6.0m in 2001, of which &pound;1.4m arose in the joint venture, as a consequence of the exceptional costs of rationalisation and acquisition integration costs and increased by &pound;17.7m as
	a result of the exceptional profit on disposal, leaving the tax charge on profits before exceptional items at &pound;52.3m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The standard rate of tax for the year is based on the United Kingdom standard rate of corporation tax of 30% (2002 &#151; 30%, 2001 &#151; 30%). The current and
	total tax charges differ from the standard rate as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	79
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage85"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	9.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Taxation &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Factors that may Affect Future Total Tax Charges
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Tax
	rates on the Group&#146;s overseas profits are generally higher than the UK corporation tax rate so changes in the proportion of profits earned overseas will affect the Group&#146;s effective tax rate over time. The current tax charge may also be
	affected by differences between tax allowances and book depreciation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	No
	deferred tax is recognised on unremitted earnings of overseas subsidiaries, associates and joint ventures. No significant additional tax charges are expected to arise on amounts that are planned to be remitted in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	No provision has been made for deferred tax on gains recognised on the sale of
	assets where potentially taxable gains have been rolled over into replacement assets. Such tax would become payable only if the assets were sold without it being possible to claim rollover relief. The total amount unprovided for is &pound;31.4m
	(2002 &#151; &pound;31.4m, 2001 &#151; &pound;31.4m). At present, it is not envisaged that any tax will become payable in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Deferred tax has not been recognised on approximately &pound;26m of unrelieved losses (2002 &#151; nil, 2001 &#151;&nbsp;nil) due to the likelihood of insufficient
	future taxable profits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The calculation of basic earnings per Ordinary Share of 15.92p (2002 &#151; 12.11p, 2001 &#151; 14.07p) is based on profit on ordinary activities after taxation and
	preference dividends of &pound;148.1m (2002 &#151; &pound;112.1m, 2001 &#151; &pound;129.6m) and on 930m Ordinary Shares (2002 &#151; 926m, 2001 &#151; 921m) being the weighted average number of shares in issue during the year. The calculation of
	diluted earnings per Ordinary Share is as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Group fixed assets include land
	with a cost of &pound;5.9m (2002 &#151; &pound;6.0m) that is not subject to depreciation. The net book value of leases with less than 50 years to run amounted to &pound;5.8m (2002 &#151; &pound;6.1m). Included in the amounts above are assets held
	under finance leases with a net book amount of &pound;3.0m (2002 &#151; &pound;2.3m). There are no properties for resale in the Group (2002 &#151; one property with a net book value of &pound;1.1m).
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Goodwill arising on the
	formation of the joint venture is considered to have an indefinite useful economic life and is capable of separate measurement since the joint venture operates independently of the Group. It operates in a mature sector of the medical devices
	industry, has high market shares, and long product life cycles. Significant barriers to entry exist in terms of technology, manufacturing know-how, regulatory compliance, market reputation and customer relationships. If the goodwill had been
	amortised over 20 years, operating profit would have been lower by &pound;3.6m (2002 &#151; &pound;3.2m) and the investment in the joint venture would have been lower by &pound;9.4m (2002 &#151; &pound;5.8m).
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The investment was disposed of
	in September 2003. At 31 December 2002 the investment of &pound;8.5m consisted of goodwill of &pound;15.4m less share of net liabilities of &pound;6.9m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Goodwill in the associated undertaking was considered to have an indefinite useful economic life and to be capable of separate measurement since the associated
	undertaking operated independently of the Group. It operated in the rehabilitation industry, had high market shares, and long product life cycles. Significant barriers to entry existed in terms of breadth of the product range, sales force size,
	physical distribution capabilities, key customer and professional relationships and market reputation. If the goodwill had been amortised over 20 years, operating profit would have been lower in 2003 by &pound;0.6m and the profit on disposal of the
	associated undertaking would have been higher by &pound;1.2m (2002 &#151; operating profit and the investment in associated undertaking lower by &pound;0.6m).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	85
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	19.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Debtors &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group utilises a debt factoring facility in Italy. The finance provider&#146;s agreement states that it cannot seek recourse in any form from the Group in the
	event of non-payment by the debtors. The Group is not obliged, and currently does not intend, to support any such losses. The gross amount of trade debtors factored without recourse is &pound;19.9m (2002 &#151; &pound;18.3m). &pound;0.9m (2002
	&#151; &pound;0.9m) of factoring charges were recognised in the period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Trade and other debtors are stated after deducting provisions for bad and doubtful debts of &pound;7.3m (2002 &#151; &pound;7.0m).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Deferred tax assets of &pound;4.4m (2002 &#151; &pound;4.0m) represent recoverable short-term timing differences.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Other debtors falling due after more than one year are non-interest bearing and
	denominated in various currencies. The fair value of these debtors is the same as book value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In addition to the above
	borrowings, other financial liabilities are nil (2002 &#151; &pound;0.3m, being 5
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUP>
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	/
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">
	% cumulative preference shares without
	a fixed maturity as set out in Note 24).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Board has
	established a set of policies to manage funding and currency risks. The Group only uses derivative financial instruments to manage the financial risks associated with underlying business activities and their financing. The Group&#146;s policy is to
	ensure that there is sufficient funding and facilities in place to meet foreseeable borrowing requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Bank loans and overdrafts represent drawings under committed and uncommitted facilities of &pound;358m and &pound;231m, respectively. Of the undrawn committed
	facilities of &pound;198m, &pound;9m expire within one year and &pound;189m after two but within five years (2002 &#151; undrawn committed facilities: &pound;199m of which &pound;3m expire within one year and &pound;196m after two but within five
	years). Borrowings secured on fixed and current assets were &pound;1.2m (2002 &#151; &pound;0.9m). Balances on currency swaps and borrowings are shown at book value which is the same as fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group and parent company have currency swaps which have maturities ranging from
	2004 to 2006 and are translated at year end exchange rates. For the Group, gross sterling equivalents of &pound;603.4m (2002 &#151; &pound;579.9m) receivable and &pound;560.0m (2002 &#151; &pound;563.2m) payable have been netted. &pound;52.8m is
	reported as debit balances on currency swaps and &pound;9.4m as credit balances on currency swaps the net of which is a debit balance of &pound;43.4m (2002 &#151; &pound;21.3m as debit balances on currency swaps and &pound;4.6m as credit balances on
	currency swaps the net of which is a debit balance of &pound;16.7m). For the parent company, gross sterling equivalents of &pound;593.1m (2002 &#151; &pound;564.4m) receivable and &pound;550.9m (2002 &#151; &pound;548.0m) payable have been netted.
	&pound;51.6m is reported as debit balances on currency swaps and &pound;9.4m as credit balances on currency swaps the net of which is a debit balance of &pound;42.2m. (2002 &#151; &pound;21.0m as debit balances on currency swaps and &pound;4.6m in
	credit balances on currency swaps the net of which is a debit balance of &pound;16.4m). Currency swaps include forward foreign exchange contracts and are used for hedging foreign investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	87
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	US$46.0
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<HR SIZE="1" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	579.9
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<HR SIZE="3" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The majority of the Group&#146;s
	financial assets and liabilities, including currency swaps, are at floating interest rates relating to the currencies concerned. The Group uses simple floating to fixed rate contract interest rate swaps to protect borrowing costs and the
	differentials between borrowing and deposit rates. 79% of the interest costs and 84% of the interest income are protected through 31 December 2004, with some protection carrying over into 2005.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group&#146;s policy is to protect
	shareholders&#146; funds by matching foreign currency assets, including acquisition goodwill, with foreign currency liabilities where practicable. These liabilities take the form of either borrowings or currency swaps. The Group also hedges forward
	its interest rate risk for up to two years using interest rate swap contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	88
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The above interest rate analysis
	includes the effect of interest rate swaps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Floating rates on both
	assets and liabilities are typically based on the three-month LIBOR interest rate relevant to the currency concerned.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	89
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Financial Instruments &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At 31 December 2003, notional principal balances by currency and related interest rates under interest rate swap agreements were:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The fair values for interest
	rate swaps are calculated as the net present value of the future cash flows as at 31 December 2003, discounted at market rates of interest at that date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">

	At 31 December 2002, notional principal balances by currency and related interest rates under interest rate swap agreements were:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The fair values for interest
	rate swaps are calculated as the net present value of the future cash flows as at 31 December 2002, discounted at market rates of interest at that date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Foreign Exchange
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group uses forward foreign exchange
	contracts to hedge trading creditors and an element of anticipated purchases over the following 12 months. The principal currencies hedged by forward foreign exchange contracts are sterling and US Dollars. At 31 December 2003, the Group had
	contracted to exchange within one year the equivalent of &pound;199m.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group&#146;s operating units hold no material unhedged monetary assets or liabilities other than in their functional operating currency. Therefore, there are no currency exposures on monetary assets and liabilities that could give rise
	to material gains or losses in the profit and loss account.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	90
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>

<TR>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Financial Instruments &#151; (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Fair Value of Financial Assets and Liabilities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Forward
	foreign exchange contracts and interest rate swap contracts, taken out as hedges, are not marked to market. Gains and losses thereon are recognised only when the exposure that is being hedged is itself recognised. The following table sets out the
	book and fair values of the Group&#146;s derivative financial instruments. Market rates have been used to determine the fair values of interest rate swaps, currency swaps and forward contracts.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">

</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The fair value of primary
	financial instruments comprising cash and borrowings which are set out in Note 20 is the same as book value.

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Group amounts falling due after
	more than one year are payable as follows: &pound;5.6m in 2005 and &pound;3.2m in 2006 (2002 &#151; &pound;2.8m in 2004, &pound;1.7m in 2005 and &pound;1.8m in 2006). Parent amounts falling due after one year are payable as follows: &pound;3.6m in
	2005 and &pound;1.2m in 2006 (2002 &#151; &pound;1.3m payable in 2004).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At 31 December 2003,
	rationalisation and integration provisions include acquisition integration of &pound;2.6m (2002 &#151; &pound;3.9m). The deferred taxation and retirement healthcare provisions are long-term in nature, as is the timing of their utilisation.
	Rationalisation and integration and other liability provisions are expected to be substantially utilised within two years. There are no provisions for contractual amounts and hence none are treated as financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The movement in provisions for liabilities and charges within the parent company during
	the year from &pound;2.6m to &pound;1.2m represents utilisation of provisions and changes in deferred taxation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	92
</FONT>
</P>
