</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Adjusted basic earnings per Ordinary Share is calculated by dividing profit before taxation, goodwill amortisation and exceptional items less taxation on profit before exceptional items by
	the average number of shares.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Accounting Calendar
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The application of the Group&#146;s internal accounting calendar means that the first quarter of 2004 will contain four more working days than the first
	quarter of 2003. Reported sales growth in quarter one will be inflated as a result of these additional days but underlying growth rates will be adjusted to exclude this effect. Quarter four 2004 will contain three less working days than the same
	quarter in 2003 and underlying rates of sales growth will correct for this effect.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	127
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	SHARE CAPITAL
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The principal trading market for the Ordinary Shares is the London Stock Exchange. The Ordinary Shares were listed on the New York Stock Exchange on 16 November 1999, trading in
	the form of ADSs evidenced by ADRs. On 15 December 2003 a ratio change was effected whereby the number of ordinary shares represented by each ADS changed from ten to five. All prices of ADSs prior to this date have been restated to reflect this
	ratio change. The ADR facility is sponsored by the Bank of New York acting as depositary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Shareholdings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of 8 March 2004, 3,967,473 ADSs equivalent to 19,837,365 Ordinary Shares or approximately 2% of the total Ordinary Shares in issue,
	were outstanding and were held by 40 registered holders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of 8 March 2004, to the
	knowledge of the Group, there were 26,836 registered holders of Ordinary Shares, of whom 92 had registered addresses in the US and held a total of 337,713 Ordinary Shares (0.04% of the total issued). Because certain Ordinary Shares are registered in
	the names of nominees, the number of shareholders with registered addresses in the US is not representative of the number of beneficial owners of Ordinary Shares resident in the US.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Until 23 June 2003 Smith &amp; Nephew had in issue 268,501 5.50% Cumulative Preference Shares of &pound;1 each, whose right to a dividend of 5.50% per
	annum was preferred over the rights to dividends of the holders of Ordinary Shares. The Cumulative Preference Shares were cancelled and repaid on 7 July 2003.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Major Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As far as is known to Smith &amp; Nephew, the Group is not directly
	or indirectly owned or controlled by another corporation or by any government.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of 8
	March 2004, no persons are known to Smith &amp; Nephew to have any interest (as defined in the Companies Act 1985) in 3% or more of the Ordinary Shares, other than FMR Corp &amp; Fidelity (8.3%, 77,502,828 Ordinary Shares), Capital Group of
	Companies Inc (6.8%, 63,396,025 Ordinary Shares), AXA Investment Managers (3.7%, 34,377,968 Ordinary Shares), and Legal &amp; General Investment Management (3.4%, 31,890,915 Ordinary Shares).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following table shows changes over the last three years in the percentage of the issued share
	capital for the Company held by major shareholders, as notified to the Company under the Companies Act 1985:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Exchange Controls and Other Limitations
	Affecting Security Holders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There are no UK governmental laws, decrees or regulations that restrict the export or import of capital or that affect the payment of
	dividends, interest or other payments to non-resident holders of Smith &amp; Nephew&#146;s securities, except for certain restrictions imposed from time to time by Her Majesty&#146;s Treasury of the United Kingdom pursuant to legislation, such as
	the United Nations Act 1946 and the Emergency Laws Act 1964, against the government or residents of certain countries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There are no limitations, either under the laws of the UK or under the Articles of Association of Smith &amp; Nephew, restricting the right of non-UK residents to hold or to
	exercise voting rights in respect of Ordinary Shares, except that where any overseas shareholder has not provided to the Company a UK address for the service of notices, the Company is under no obligation to send any notice or other document to an
	overseas address. It is, however, the current practice of the Company to send every notice or other document to all shareholders regardless of the country recorded in the register of members, with the exception of details of the Company&#146;s
	dividend re-investment plan, which are not sent to shareholders with recorded addresses in the US and Canada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	128
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The information provided below is given for principal subsidiary undertakings, all of which are 100% owned, in accordance with Section 231(5)(a) of
	the Companies Act 1985. A full list will be appended to Smith &amp; Nephew&#146;s next annual return to Companies House:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Principal Associated Undertakings, Joint
	Ventures and Other Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Group owns 50% of BSN Medical GmbH &amp; Co KG, a medical supplies company incorporated in Germany.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2002, the Group owned 21.5% of AbilityOne Corporation, a supplier of rehabilitation products to
	hospitals, nursing homes and clinics incorporated in the United States. During 2003, the Group disposed of this interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2001, the Group owned interests in two joint arrangements with Advanced Tissue Sciences, Inc., one relating to products for the treatment of diabetic foot ulcers and other wound
	indications, and the other for cartilage replacement. In 2002, the Group acquired the interests it did not already own in the joint arrangements from Advanced Tissue Sciences, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	129
</FONT>
</P>

	Group balance sheet comparatives have been restated for the adoption of UITF 38.

</TABLE>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(iii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Adjusted basic earnings per Ordinary Share is calculated by dividing profit before taxation, goodwill amortisation and exceptional items less taxation on profit before exceptional items by
	the average number of shares.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	131
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Amounts in accordance with US GAAP:
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Smith &amp; Nephew prepares its accounts in accordance with UK GAAP which differ in certain respects from US&nbsp;GAAP. A summary of differences and reconciliations of profit for the financial year and shareholders&#146; funds for the
	relevant years are set out in Note 40 of Notes to the Accounts. Key Profit and Loss and Balance Sheet data are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>

</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The average of the Noon Buying Rates on the last day of each month during the fiscal year.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	133
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage139"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	TAXATION INFORMATION FOR SHAREHOLDERS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The comments below are of a general and summary nature and are based on the Group&#146;s understanding of certain aspects of current UK and US federal
	income tax law and practice relevant to the ADSs and Ordinary Shares not in ADS form. The comments address the material US and UK tax consequences generally applicable to a person who is the beneficial owner of ADSs or Ordinary Shares and who, for
	US federal income tax purposes, is a US citizen or resident, a corporation (or other entity treated as a corporation) created or organised in or under the laws of the United States, or an estate or trust the income of which is included in gross
	income for US federal income tax purposes (a &#147;US Holder&#148;). The comments set out below do not purport to address all tax consequences of the ownership of ADSs or Ordinary Shares which may be material to a particular holder and in particular
	do not deal with the position of shareholders who directly or indirectly own 10% or more of the issued Ordinary Shares. This discussion does not apply to persons operating clearance and/or depository services and those whose holding of ADSs or
	Ordinary Shares is effectively connected with or pertains to either (i) a permanent establishment in the United Kingdom through which the US Holder carries on a business in the United Kingdom, or (ii) a fixed base from which the US Holder performs
	independent personal services in the United Kingdom. This discussion does not apply to certain investors such as tax-exempt entities, insurance companies, broker-dealers, traders in securities that elect to mark to market, US Holders holding ADSs or
	Ordinary Shares as part of a hedging or conversion transaction or whose functional currency is other than the US dollar and investors liable for alternative minimum tax. In addition, the comments below do not address US state, local or non-US (other
	than UK) taxes. The summary deals only with US Holders who hold ADSs or Ordinary Shares as capital assets. The summary is based on the Company&#146;s understanding of current US and UK law and practice and advice received from the Company&#146;s UK
	and US tax advisors. US Holders are recommended to consult their own tax advisors as to the particular consequences to them of the ownership of ADSs or Ordinary Shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	This discussion is based in part on representations by the depositary and assumes that each obligation under the deposit agreement and any related
	agreement will be performed in accordance with its terms. For the purpose of the US/UK Double Taxation Treaty (the &#147;Treaty&#148;) and the prior US/UK Double Taxation Treaty (the &#147;Prior Treaty&#148;) and US federal income tax law US Holders
	of ADSs will be treated as owners of the Ordinary Shares represented by the ADSs. However, the US Treasury has expressed concerns that parties to whom depositary shares are pre-released may be taking actions that are inconsistent with the claiming
	of foreign tax credits by owners of ADSs. Accordingly, the analysis of the creditability of UK taxes described below could be affected by future actions that may be taken by the US Treasury.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Taxation of Dividends in The United Kingdom and the United States
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under the Prior Treaty, certain US Holders who are the beneficial owners of dividends on Ordinary Shares or ADSs were generally entitled to a tax credit payment in respect of
	dividends equal to one-ninth of the dividend paid (the &#147;Tax Credit Amount&#148;). This tax credit payment is reduced by a UK withholding (the &#147;UK withholding&#148;) of up to 15% of the gross dividend paid. Therefore, a US Holder will not
	actually receive any payment of this credit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under the Treaty, US Holders are no longer
	entitled to the Tax Credit Amount because the Treaty does not provide for that entitlement. The Treaty applies to dividend payments after 1 May 2003. However, if a US Holder would have been entitled to greater benefits under the Prior Treaty, the US
	Holder may elect to continue to apply the Prior Treaty until 1 May 2004.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Dividends paid
	and, if a US Holder elects under the Prior Treaty to claim a foreign tax credit with respect to the UK withholding, the associated Tax Credit Amount will be treated as foreign source ordinary income to a US Holder when the dividend is received to
	the extent paid out of current or accumulated earnings and profits as determined for US federal income tax purposes. Dividends will not be eligible for the dividends-received deduction generally allowed to US corporations in respect of dividends
	received from other US corporations. The amount of the dividend included in taxable income is the US dollar value of the dividend, converted using the exchange rate on the date the depositary receives the dividend in the case of ADSs, or the date
	the US Holder receives the dividend in the case of Ordinary Shares. Conversion by a US Holder of sterling received as a distribution from Smith &amp; Nephew into US dollars may result in US source ordinary income to the US Holder to the extent
	attributable to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates between the date of receipt and the date of conversion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under recently enacted US legislation, dividends received by noncorporate US Holders of Ordinary Shares or ADSs may be subject to US federal income tax at lower rates than other
	types of ordinary income if certain
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	134
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage140"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	conditions are met. US Holders should consult their own tax advisors regarding the application of this new legislation to their particular circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For US foreign tax credit limitation purposes, dividends, and any associated Tax Credit Amounts,
	will be &#147;passive income&#148; (or, in the case of certain holders, &#147;financial services income&#148;). The UK withholding under the Prior Treaty is treated as foreign income tax which may, subject to certain limitations and restrictions, be
	eligible for credit against a US Holder&#146;s US federal income tax liability for a US Holder that elects to include the associated Tax Credit Amount in income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Taxation of Capital Gains
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	US Holders, who are not resident
	or ordinarily resident for tax purposes in the UK, will not generally be liable for UK capital gains tax on any capital gain realised upon the sale or other disposition of ADSs or Ordinary Shares unless held in connection with a trade carried on in
	the UK through a permanent establishment. Furthermore, UK resident individuals who acquire ADSs or Ordinary Shares before becoming temporarily non-UK resident, may remain subject to UK taxation of capital gains on gains realised while non-resident.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For US tax purposes, gains realised upon the sale or disposition of ADSs or Ordinary
	Shares by US Holders generally will be US source capital gains and will be long-term US source capital gains if the ADSs or Ordinary Shares were held for more than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Inheritance and Estate Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The UK Inland Revenue imposes
	inheritance tax on capital transfers which occur on death, and in the seven years preceding death. The UK Inland Revenue considers that the US/UK Double Taxation Convention on Estate and Gift Tax applies to inheritance tax. Consequently, a US
	citizen who is domiciled in the United States and is not a UK national or domiciled in the United Kingdom will not be subject to UK inheritance tax in respect of ADSs and Ordinary Shares. A UK national who is domiciled in the United States will be
	subject to both UK inheritance tax and US Federal Estate Tax but will be entitled to a credit for US Federal Estate Tax charged in respect of ADSs and Ordinary Shares in computing the liability to UK inheritance tax. Conversely, a US citizen who is
	domiciled or deemed domiciled in the United Kingdom will be entitled to a credit for UK inheritance tax charged in respect of ADSs and Ordinary Shares in computing the liability to US Federal Estate Tax. Special rules apply where ADSs and Ordinary
	Shares are business property of a permanent establishment of an enterprise situated in the United Kingdom.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	US Backup Withholding Tax
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A US Holder may be subject to US backup withholding tax on dividends paid or the proceeds of sales made within
	the US, or through certain US-related foreign persons, unless the shareholder is a corporation or other exempt recipient, or provides a US taxpayer identification number. US backup withholding tax may also apply if there has been a notification from
	the Internal Revenue Service of a failure to report all interest or dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Backup
	withholding tax deducted may be credited against the US Holder&#146;s US income tax liability, and, where the withholding tax exceeds the actual liability, the US Holder may obtain a refund by filing the appropriate refund claim with the Internal
	Revenue Service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	UK Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	UK stamp duty is charged on documents and in particular instruments for the transfer of registered ownership of Ordinary Shares. Transfers of Ordinary Shares will generally be
	subject to UK stamp duty at the rate of &#189;% of the consideration given for the transfer with the duty rounded up to the nearest &pound;5 if necessary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	UK stamp duty reserve tax (&#147;SDRT&#148;) arises when there is an agreement to transfer shares in UK companies &#147;for consideration in money or money&#146;s worth&#148;, and
	so an agreement to transfer Ordinary Shares for money or other consideration may give rise to a charge to SDRT at the rate of &#189;% (rounded up to the nearest penny). If an instrument of transfer of the Ordinary Shares is subsequently executed the
	instrument of transfer will generally be subject to stamp duty. The charge of SDRT will be cancelled, and any SDRT already paid will be refunded, if within 6 years of the agreement an instrument of transfer is produced to the United Kingdom Inland
	Revenue and the appropriate stamp duty paid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	135
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Transfers of Ordinary Shares into CREST (an electronic transfer system) are exempt from stamp duty so long as the transferee is a
	member of CREST who will hold the Ordinary Shares as a nominee for the transferor and the transfer is in a form that will ensure that the securities become held in uncertificated form within CREST. Paperless transfers of Ordinary Shares within CREST
	for consideration in money or money&#146;s worth are liable to SDRT rather than stamp duty. SDRT on relevant transactions will be collected by CREST at &#189;%, and this will apply whether or not the transfer is effected in the United Kingdom and
	whether or not the parties to it are resident or situated in the United Kingdom.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A
	charge of stamp duty or SDRT at the rates of 1&#189;% of the consideration (or, in some circumstances, the value of the shares concerned) will arise on a transfer or issue of Ordinary Shares to the Depositary or to certain persons providing a
	clearance service (or their nominees or agents) and will generally be payable by the Depositary or person providing clearance service. In accordance with the terms of the Deposit Agreement, any tax or duty payable by the Depositary on deposits of
	Ordinary Shares will be charged by the Depositary to the party to whom ADRs are delivered against such deposits. No liability for SDRT will arise on any agreement to transfer an ADS or beneficial interest in an ADS.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	No liability for stamp duty will arise on any transfer of, or agreement to transfer, an ADS or
	beneficial ownership of an ADS, provided that the ADS and any instrument of transfer or written agreement to transfer remains at all times outside the United Kingdom, and provided further that any instrument of transfer or written agreement to
	transfer is not executed in the United Kingdom and the transfer does not relate to any matter or thing done or to be done in the United Kingdom (the location of the custodian as a holder of Ordinary Shares not being relevant in this context). In any
	other case, any transfer of, or agreement to transfer, an ADS or beneficial ownership of an ADS could, depending on all the circumstances of the transfer, give rise to a charge to stamp duty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	136
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	MEMORANDUM AND ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following summarises certain material rights of holders of the Company&#146;s Ordinary Shares under the material provisions of the Company&#146;s
	memorandum and articles of association and English law. This summary is qualified in its entirety by reference to the Companies Act 1985 and the Company&#146;s memorandum and articles of association. Copies of the Company&#146;s memorandum and
	articles of association have been filed as exhibits to this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The
	Company&#146;s shares may be held in certificated or uncertificated form. No holder of the Company&#146;s shares will be required to make additional contributions of capital in respect of the Company&#146;s shares in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the following description, a &#147;shareholder&#148; is the person registered in the Company&#146;s
	register of members as the holder of an ordinary share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company is incorporated
	under the name &#147;Smith &amp; Nephew plc&#148; and is registered in England and Wales with registered number 324357. The fourth clause of the Company&#146;s memorandum of association provides that its objects include to carry on business as an
	investment holding company, to carry on all or any of the businesses of dealers in and manufacturers of surgical dressings and instruments, pharmaceutical preparations or articles, proprietary articles of all kinds, surgical and scientific apparatus
	and materials of all kinds and buyers and sellers of goods of all kinds. The memorandum grants to the Company a range of corporate capabilities to effect these objects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under the Company&#146;s articles of association,
	a Director may not vote in respect of any contract, arrangement, transaction or proposal in which he, or any person connected with him, has any material interest other than by virtue of his interests in securities of, or otherwise in or through, the
	Company. This is subject to certain exceptions relating to proposals (a) indemnifying him in respect of obligations incurred on behalf of the Company, (b) indemnifying a third party in respect of obligations of the Company for which the Director has
	assumed responsibility under an indemnity or guarantee, (c) relating to an offer of securities in which he will be interested as an underwriter, (d) concerning another body corporate in which the Director is beneficially interested in less than one
	percent of the issued shares of any class of shares of such a body corporate, (e) relating to an employee benefit in which the director will share equally with other employees and (f) relating to any insurance that the Company is empowered to
	purchase for the benefit of Directors of the Company in respect of actions undertaken as Directors (or officers) of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A Director shall not vote or be counted in any quorum concerning his own appointment or terms of his appointment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Directors are empowered to exercise all the powers of the Company to borrow money, subject to the limitation that the aggregate amount of all
	monies borrowed after deducting cash and current asset investments by the Company and its subsidiaries shall not exceed an amount equal to two and one half times the Company&#146;s consolidated share capital and aggregate reserves, but after:
	adjustments for the variation to share capital and aggregate reserves since the latest audited consolidated balance sheet; deducting distributed and proposed distributions not previously provided out of profits earned prior to the date of the latest
	audited consolidated balance sheet, any amount attributable to non-Group shareholders in subsidiaries of the Company and any debit balance on the combined or Group profit and loss account, unless sanctioned by an ordinary resolution of the Company;
	adding back any goodwill on the acquisition of businesses that had been previously set off against reserves to the extent that the businesses have not been discontinued or disposed of and after deducting any permanent decrease in the value of these
	businesses; and making such adjustments as the auditors may consider appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Any
	Director who has been appointed by the Directors since the previous Annual General Meeting of shareholders, either to fill a casual vacancy or as an additional Director, holds office only until the next Annual General Meeting and then shall be
	eligible for election by the shareholders. The other Directors shall retire and be eligible for re-appointment at the third annual general meeting after the meeting at which they were last re-appointed. The Directors are subject to removal with or
	without cause by the Board or the Shareholders. Any director attaining 70 years of age shall retire at the next Annual General Meeting. Such a Director may be re-appointed but shall retire (and be eligible for reappointment) at the next Annual
	General Meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	137
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Directors are not required to hold any shares of the Company by way of qualification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Rights Attaching to Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under English law, dividends are payable on the Company&#146;s Ordinary Shares only out of profits available for distribution, as determined in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United Kingdom and
	by the Companies Act. Holders of the Company&#146;s Ordinary Shares are entitled to receive such dividends as may be declared by the shareholders in general meeting, rateable according to the amounts paid up on such shares, provided that the
	dividend cannot exceed the amount recommended by the Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s Board
	of Directors may pay shareholders such interim dividends as appear to them to be justified by the Company&#146;s financial position. If authorised by an ordinary resolution of the shareholders, the Board may also direct payment of a dividend in
	whole or in part by the distribution of specific assets (and in particular of paid up shares or debentures of the Company).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Any dividend unclaimed after 12 years from the date the dividend was declared, or became due for payment, will be forfeited and will revert to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Voting Rights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Voting at any general meeting of shareholders is by a show of hands unless a poll, which is a written vote, is duly demanded. On a show of hands, every shareholder who is present in person or by proxy at a general meeting has one vote
	regardless of the number of shares held. On a poll, every shareholder who is present in person or by proxy has one vote for every 12
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUP>
	&nbsp;2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	/
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">
	pence in nominal amount of the shares held by that shareholder. A poll may be demanded by any of the following:
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	the chairman of the meeting;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	at least five shareholders entitled to vote at the meeting;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	any shareholder or shareholders representing in the aggregate not less than one-tenth of the total voting rights of all shareholders entitled to vote at the meeting; or
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	any shareholder or shareholders holding shares conferring a right to vote at the meeting on which there have been paid-up sums in aggregate equal to not less than one-tenth of the total sum
	paid up on all the shares conferring that right.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A proxy form will be
	treated as giving the proxy the authority to demand a poll, or to join others in demanding one.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The necessary quorum for a general meeting is two shareholders present in person carrying a right to vote upon the business to be transacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Matters are transacted at general meetings of the Company by the processing and passing of resolutions of which there are three kinds:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	an ordinary resolution, which includes resolutions for the election of Directors, the approval of financial statements, the cumulative annual payment of dividends, the appointment of
	auditors, the increase of authorised share capital or the grant of authority to allot shares;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	a special resolution, which includes resolutions amending the Company&#146;s memorandum and articles of association, disapplying statutory pre-emption rights or changing the Company&#146;s
	name; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	an extraordinary resolution, which includes resolutions modifying the rights of any class of the Company&#146;s shares at a meeting of the holders of such class or relating to certain matters
	concerning the Company&#146;s winding up.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	An ordinary resolution requires
	the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes of those persons voting at a meeting at which there is a quorum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Special and extraordinary resolutions require the affirmative vote of not less than three-quarters of the persons voting at a meeting at which there is a quorum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	138
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the case of an equality of votes, whether on a show of hands or on a poll, the chairman of the meeting is entitled to cast the
	deciding vote in addition to any other vote he may have.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Annual General Meetings must be
	convened upon advance written notice of 21 days. Other meetings must be convened upon advance written notice of 21 days for the passing of a special resolution and 14 days for any other resolution, depending on the nature of the business to be
	transacted. The days of delivery or receipt of notice are not included. The notice must specify the nature of the business to be transacted. Meetings are convened by the Board of Directors. Members with 10% of the Ordinary Share capital of the
	Company may requisition the Board to convene a meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Variation of Rights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	If, at any time, the Company&#146;s share capital is divided into different classes of shares, the rights attached to any class may be varied, subject to the
	provisions of the Companies Act, with the consent in writing of holders of three-quarters in value of the shares of that class or upon the adoption of an extraordinary resolution passed at a separate meeting of the holders of the shares of that
	class. At every such separate meeting, all of the provisions of the articles of association relating to proceedings at an Extraordinary General Meeting apply, except that the quorum is to be the number of persons (which must be two or more) who hold
	or represent by proxy not less than one-third in nominal value of the issued shares of the class and at any such meeting a poll may be demanded in writing by any five persons who hold or represent by proxy not less than one fortieth of the nominal
	value of the shares of that class.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Rights in a Winding-Up
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Except as the Company&#146;s shareholders have agreed or may otherwise agree, upon the Company&#146;s winding up, the balance of assets available for distribution:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	after the payment of all creditors including certain preferential creditors, whether statutorily preferred creditors or normal creditors; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	subject to any special rights attaching to any other class of shares;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	is to be distributed among the holders of ordinary shares according to the amounts paid-up on the shares held by them. This distribution is generally to be made in cash. A
	liquidator may, however, upon the adoption of any extraordinary resolution of the shareholders and any other sanction required by law, divide among the shareholders the whole or any part of the Company&#146;s assets in kind.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Limitations on Voting and Shareholding
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There are no limitations imposed by English law or the Company&#146;s memorandum or articles of association on the right of non-residents or foreign persons to hold or vote the
	Company&#146;s ordinary shares or ADSs, other than the limitations that would generally apply to all of the Company&#146;s shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	141
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_149"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5">
	GLOSSARY OF TERMS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Unless the context indicates otherwise, the following terms have the meanings shown below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="66%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Term
</FONT>
</P>
<HR WIDTH="35" SIZE="1" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" COLOR="#000000">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Meaning
</FONT>
</P>
<HR WIDTH="63" SIZE="1" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" COLOR="#000000">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	510k Clearance
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	FDA grants 510(k) clearance for a device once it is determined that the device is substantially equivalent to another device on the market. To be substantially equivalent, the device must have the same
	indications for use and be mechanically equivalent to another device cleared for sale in the US. Once the device has 510(k) clearance, the device can be legally placed on the US market.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	ADR
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the US, The Company&#146;s Ordinary Shares are traded in the term of ADSs evidenced by American Depository Receipts (&#147;ADRs&#148;).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">

<TD HEIGHT="8">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A product group within endoscopy comprising fluid management and insufflations instruments for better surgical access.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>

<TR>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A product group comprising products associated with the treatment of skin wounds, ranging from products that provide moist wound healing using breathable films and polymers to products providing active
	wound healing by biochemical or cellular action.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8">

<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A product group comprising products that are used externally to immobilise a bone fracture or damaged joint, usually made of plaster of paris or synthetic materials.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Chronic and acute wounds
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Chronic wounds are those with long or unknown healing times including leg ulcers, pressure sores and diabetic foot ulcers. Acute wounds are those for which healing times can be reasonably predicted such
	as surgical and post-operative wounds.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

</TD>

</FONT>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Endoscopy allows surgeons to operate through coin-sized openings in the body, rather than large incisions.
</FONT>
</TD>

<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A product group comprising specialised viewing and access devices, surgical instruments and powered equipment used in minimally invasive surgical procedures. Through a small incision surgeons are able to
	see inside the body using a monitor and identify and repair defects.
</FONT>
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	HA
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Hydroxyapatite, (HA) is a ceramic material that is similar in composition to bone. Devices with HA are implanted without the use of bone cement.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	IDET procedure
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Intradiscal Electrothermal Therapy (IDET) is a thermal procedure intended for the shrinkage and decompression of the spinal disc to treat patients with annular disruption of contained
	herniations.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Image guided surgery
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The use of computer-tracking in orthopaedics surgery to give surgeons real-time precise feedback on the positioning of surgical instruments relative to a patient&#146;s anatomy.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The use of plates, nails, rods, pins, bands, screws, bolts and staples in the correction of skeletal defects.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">

	hip resurfacing
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A less invasive surgical approach to treating arthritis in younger patients whereby only the surfaces of the hip joint are replaced leaving the hip head substantially preserved.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">

<TD HEIGHT="8">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Products that comprise implants, devices and systems to replace diseased or injured hip, knee and shoulder joints, and trauma devices such as rods, pins, screws, plates and external frames used to treat
	bone fractures.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Papain urea
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Papain urea is a compound of an enzyme extracted from papaya and an organic wound softening agent.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Porous coated knee
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Porous knee replacement parts are components that are coated with small beads. When several layers of beads are applied to the parts the bone can grow into the holes between the beads which provide
	additional component fixation to the bone.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>

</FONT>

	A business segment comprising products equipment and systems used to increase, maintain or improve patient functional capabilities after surgery, or stroke or of individuals with
	disabilities.

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Repair
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A product group within endoscopy comprising specialised devices, fixation systems and bioabsorbable materials to repair joints and associated tissue.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Products that cut or ablate tissue within endoscopy comprising mechanical blades, radio frequency wands, electromechanical and hand instruments for resecting tissue
</FONT>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Exclusion of Table A
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No regulations for management of a company set out in, or in any subordinate legislation made under, any statute concerning companies shall apply as the
	articles or regulations of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

	if not inconsistent with the subject or context:-

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

	means the directors for the time being of the Company, or, as the case may be, the board of directors for the time being of the Company or the persons present at a duly convened meeting of the
	board of directors or any duly authorised committee thereof at which a quorum is present
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;dividend&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means dividend or bonus
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;Dividend Beneficiary&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means in relation to a particular dividend an S&amp;N Group Shareholder who has made (or shall be deemed to have made) a Valid Dividend Election which is subsisting at the Relevant Time for that
	dividend
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;Elected Shares&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means as regards a particular S&amp;N Group Shareholder and in relation to a particular dividend proposed to be declared by Smith &amp; Nephew Group (or, in the case of a Total Election
	Condition subsisting, a particular dividend announced by Smith &amp; Nephew Group as being payable by the Company) that number of Common Access Shares equal to the number of S&amp;N Group Shares in respect of which that S&amp;N Group Shareholder has
	made Valid Dividend Elections which subsist (or which are deemed to subsist) as at the Relevant Time for that particular dividend
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

	means paid or credited as paid
</FONT>

<TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;record date&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means in relation to a particular dividend the date determined and announced by Smith &amp; Nephew Group as the date upon which a person must be registered as a member of Smith &amp; Nephew
	Group on the Smith &amp; Nephew Group Register in order to qualify to receive that dividend declared or payable by Smith &amp; Nephew Group on its S&amp;N Group Shares or in the case of a Total Election Condition subsisting the dividend declared or
	payable by the Company on the Access Shares
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

	&#147;Register&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means the register of members of the Company and shall so long as the Regulations so permit or require, include a related Operator register of members
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means the Uncertificated Securities Regulations 2001 (SI 2001 No 3755)
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>

<B>
	&#147;Relevant Time&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means in relation to any particular dividend the close of business on the record date for that dividend
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

	&#147;S&amp;N&nbsp;Group&nbsp;Shareholder&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means a person registered in the Smith &amp; Nephew Group Register as a holder of S&amp;N Group Shares and where there is more than one person registered jointly, the first person so registered
	to the exclusion of all others shall be deemed to be the S&amp;N Group Shareholder
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means the ordinary shares of 12.5 pence each in the capital of Smith &amp; Nephew Group
</FONT>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

	&#147;Scrip Divided Scheme&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means any scheme by Smith &amp; Nephew Group, whereby in lieu of a dividend declared on the S&amp;N Group Shares, an S&amp;N Group Shareholder may by election or otherwise, receive fully paid
	shares in the issued share capital of Smith &amp; Nephew Group
</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>

	a Total Election Condition shall subsist as regards any particular dividend which would otherwise have been declared and paid by Smith &amp; Nephew Group if at the Relevant Time for that
	dividend Valid Dividend Elections have been made (or are deemed to have been made) in respect of all the S&amp;N Group Shares then in issue

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;Valid&nbsp;Dividend&nbsp;Election&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	an S&amp;N Group Shareholder shall have made (and be deemed to have made) a Valid Dividend Election in respect of a particular dividend if at the
	Relevant Time for that dividend:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-2.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his address in the Smith &amp; Nephew Group Register is an address outside Switzerland and his S&amp;N Group Shares are
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="eolPage163"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_161"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="80%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	not held through a Swiss Clearing System and he has not given written notice to Smith &amp; Nephew Group electing to receive
	dividends on all or any of his S&amp;N Group Shares from Smith &amp; Nephew Group; or
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-2.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his address in the Smith &amp; Nephew Group Register is an address in Switzerland or his S&amp;N Group
	Shares are held through a Swiss Clearing System and he has given (and not withdrawn in writing) written notice to Smith &amp; Nephew Group electing to receive dividends in respect of all or any of his S&amp;N Group Shares from the
	Company,
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	PROVIDED that a Valid Dividend Election shall not have been made (or
	shall be deemed not to have been made):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-2.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in respect of a dividend (or the relevant part thereof) where the particular S&amp;N Group Shareholder elects or has elected (but only to the extent of such election) to receive a scrip dividend in lieu of any
	cash dividend;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-2.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in respect of a dividend (or the relevant part thereof) which is not paid in cash; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-2.00EM">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if at the relevant time the Company is no longer (directly or indirectly) a subsidiary of Smith &amp;
	Nephew Group.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;in writing&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means the representation or reproduction of words, symbols or other information in a visible form by any method or combination of methods, whether comprised in an electronic communication or
	otherwise, and &#147;written&#148; shall be construed accordingly
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&#147;year&#148;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	means any period of 12 consecutive months
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
